item.title: Holmes Sent Notebook To Psychiatrist Before Attack
item.description: James Holmes Sent Notebook To Psychiatrist Before Colorado 'Dark Knight' Massacre, Report Says http://t.co/KdFnXOmg via @HuffPostCrime
item.content:encoded: James Holmes Sent Notebook To Psychiatrist Before Colorado 'Dark Knight' Massacre, Report Says http://t.co/KdFnXOmg via @HuffPostCrime The man accused of killing a dozen people at a midnight screening of the 'The Dark Knight Rises' sent a journal detailing the rampage to a University of Colorado psychiatrist prior to the attack, only for it to go untouched in a campus mailroom, according to a Fox News report. The diary of 24-year-old James Holmes -- "full of details about how he was going to kill people" -- was discovered Monday by authorities investigating another package at the school's Anschutz medical campus in Aurora, a law enforcement official told the network. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Movie massacre suspect sent chilling notebook to psychiatrist before attack
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Movie massacre suspect sent chilling notebook to psychiatrist before attack | Fox News http://t.co/aGFbMRTh via @foxnews
item.content:encoded: EXCLUSIVE: Movie massacre suspect sent chilling notebook to psychiatrist before attack | Fox News http://t.co/aGFbMRTh via @foxnews James Holmes, the accused gunman in the Colorado midnight movie massacre, mailed a notebook full of details about how he was going to kill people to his psychiatrist before the attack, but the parcel sat unopened in a mailroom for as long as a week before its discovery Monday, a law enforcement source told FoxNews.com. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: foxnews.com

item.title: Did Chick-fil-A Pretend to Be a Teenage Girl on Facebook?
item.description:
Chick-fil-A Got Caught Pretending to Be a Teenage Girl on Facebook [Chick-Fil-A]:
... http://t.co/43c4XNCC
item.content:encoded: Chick-fil-A Got Caught Pretending to Be a Teenage Girl on Facebook [Chick-Fil-A]: ... http://t.co/43c4XNCC Chick-fil-A, home of chicken-loving bigots, is in the middle of a PR nightmare. After Chick-fil-A's COO admitted to being anti-gay, the Jim Henson Company (bless their heart) pulled their toys from Chick-fil-A's kids meals. Only Chick-fil-A claimed the toys were pulled because of a "possible safety issue". That, of course, is a complete lie. A lie that the company may be propagating with fake Facebook accounts of Chick-fil-a sympathists. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: gizmodo.com

item.description: Obama's Mission Accomplished Moment: We tried our economic plan — 'and it worked’ | http://t.co/jZ4wrfAx
item.content:encoded: Obama's Mission Accomplished Moment: We tried our economic plan — 'and it worked’ | http://t.co/jZ4wrfAx President Obama, discussing his economic policies during a fundraiser in California, told supporters last night that “we tried our plan — and it worked” as he explained why they should reelect him. Link - Trackbacks
